My GitHub Repositories

First published: Sunday, 1 January 2017.
Last modified:    09:17 PM Tuesday, 20 November 2018 (AEST).

My Atom packages

  • about-arch (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    A package (former Atom package name: about-arch) that provides an about page for Atom. I forked it from the official Atom about package, to customize it, for my Arch Linux packages and atom-installer builds.

     Forked: Yes, from atom/about.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    Not published in the Atom package registry.
  • fusion-ui (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My customized Atom UI theme forked from accents-ui.

     Forked: Yes, from kieranju/fusion-ui.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    Atom Package URL: https://atom.io/packages/fusion-ui.
  • language-archlinux (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    An Arch Linux development package for the Atom text editor. While it was not forked on GitHub from any existing GitHub repositories, it borrows much of its source code from the language-gentoo package of Nicolas Laurent.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
    Atom Package URL: https://atom.io/packages/language-archlinux.
  • language-gfm2 (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My language-gfm2 Atom package. It is essentially just the language-gfm package with pull request #154 applied.

     Forked: Yes, from atom/language-gfm.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    Atom Package URL: https://atom.io/packages/language-gfm2.
  • language-ini-desktop (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My language-ini-desktop package, which is a fork of the language-ini package with better support for desktop configuration files.

     Forked: Yes, from jacobbednarz/atom-language-ini.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    Atom Package URL: https://atom.io/packages/language-ini-desktop.
  • language-patch2 (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My language-patch2 package, which is a fork of the language-patch package, with some changes to make it easier to build custom Atom builds with it pre-installed.

     Forked: Yes, from hexpunK/language-patch.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    Not published in the Atom package registry.
  • language-solus (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    The language-solus package which provides commands for doing common Solus OS package management actions.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
    Atom Package URL: https://atom.io/packages/language-solus.
  • language-unix-shell (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My language-unix-shell package, which in itself is a fork of the core language-shellscript package with support for extra shell grammars.

     Forked: Yes, from atom/language-shellscript.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    Atom Package URL: https://atom.io/packages/language-unix-shell.
  • language-vala-modern (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My language-vala-modern package, which is a fork of the language-vala package, the main difference is that it includes the scopeName field in its grammar file, so it automatically syntax-highlights files with .vala and .vapi file extensions.

     Forked: Yes, from evfool/language-vala.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    Atom Package URL: https://atom.io/packages/language-vala-modern.
  • terminal-fusion (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My fork of the platformio-ide-terminal package, that is localized to Linux platforms. It has lost the platform-independence of its parent package (i.e., platformio-ide-terminal), due to a fix for tensor5/arch-atom#12 being applied that breaks its macOS and Windows NT compatibility. This fix also gave rise to my pty.js fork.

     Forked: Yes, from platformio/platformio-ide-terminal.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    Not published in the Atom package registry.
  • toolbar-fusion (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    A toolbar to aid in software development, especially for projects written in C, C++ or an interpreted language such as Python.

     Forked: Yes, from radjivC/awesome-tool-bar.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    Atom Package URL: https://atom.io/packages/toolbar-fusion.

My other GitHub repositories

AppImage

  • AppImages (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    Recipes (shell scripts) for building AppImages, forked from probonopd/AppImages.

     Forked: Yes, from probonopd/AppImages.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
    The Hornery Link: /appimages/.
  • Code-OSS.AppImage (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    A repository that, using Travis CI, is used to build a Code (OSS) AppImage and upload it to the continuous tag of this very repository.

     Forked: No.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
  • Emacs.AppImage (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    A repository that, using Travis CI, is used to build a Emacs AppImage and upload it to Bintray.

     Forked: Yes, from probonopd/Emacs.AppImage.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
  • GVim.AppImage (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    A repository that, using Travis CI, is used to build a GVim AppImage and upload it to the continuous tag of this very repository.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.

Configuration

  • atom (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    Configuration files for Atom, specifically the configuration files found in my ~/.atom directory.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • emacs (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My emacs configuration settings (stored in ~/.emacs). Has a quick install script too.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • funtoo-config Description:

    My Funtoo configuration settings.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • gentoo-config Description:

    My Gentoo configuration settings.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • i3-configs Description:

    My i3 configuration settings. Written in C++, Python and Shell.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • spacemacs (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My ~/.spacemacs file.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: No.
  • vim Description:

    My ~/.vimrc file.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: No.

Installers

  • atom-installer (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    An automated shell script installer for the Atom text editor that should work on most Linux distributions.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • atom-quick-install (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    An automated quick installer for Atom using only official Linux binaries.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • atom-runner (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    A shell script for running (technically not installing, but I class installers and runners together) Atom on 64-bit Linux using AppImages.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • brackets-installer (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    An automated shell script installer for the Brackets text editor that should work on most Linux distributions.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • komodo-installer (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    An automated shell script installer for Komodo Edit on Linux.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • lighttable-installer (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    An automated shell script installer for the LightTable IDE that should work on most Linux distributions.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • vscode-installer (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    An automated shell script installer for the Visual Studio Code text editor that should work on most Linux distributions.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.

ISO-building

  • archiso (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    Tools for automating the generation of ISOs for Arch Linux with out-of-the-box support for Broadcom Wireless.

     Forked: No.
    README: Yes.
  • fedora-ISO (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    A collection of files for the generation of a custom Fedora ISO with out-of-the-box support for Broadcom Wireless. So far this repository is a work-in-progress and not yet ready for use. I have asked for help with this on Ask Fedora.

     Forked: No.
    README: No.

Mathematics

  • C-Math-Projects Description:

    Math projects written, predominantly, in C. Used for the purpose of helping me learn C.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • CPP-Math-Projects Description:

    Math projects written, predominantly, in C++. Used for the purpose of helping me learn C++.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • GNU_Octave Description:

    Scripts written for scientific computing in GNU Octave

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: No.
  • JScripts Description:

    Contains assorted JavaScript scripts written primarily for scientific computing.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • julia-scripts Description:

    Contains assorted Julia scripts written primarily for scientific computing.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • python-scripts Description:

    Assorted Python scripts used to perform numerical computations.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.

Operating system setup

  • arch-setup (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    Scripts for automating the installation of Arch Linux on laptops with Broadcom WiFi chips.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.

Other scripts

  • bin (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    Executable scripts found in my ~/bin folder that, when added to my PATH environment variable, can be used to automate some otherwise tedious OBS tasks.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • npm2archOBS (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    Tools to automate the process of adding Node.js packages to the Open Build Service.

     Forked: Yes, from /.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.

Packaging

  • fusion809-overlay Description:

    Assorted ebuilds for building packages not provided by the Portage tree or any of the following overlays: (1) flatpak-overlay, (2) gamerlay, (3) games-overlay, (4) gnome, (5) grub2-themes, (6) kde, (7) mozilla, (8) spring and (9) steam-overlay. Sometimes an older version of my ebuilds are provided by these or other overlays.

     Forked: Yes, from funtoo/skeletal-overlay.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • PKGBUILDs Description:

    Assorted PKGBUILDs for building packages that are not provided (or at least, not adequately provided) by the AUR, Arch Linux official repositories or my Open Build Service project. This repository as -old and -old2 versions, which refer to old versions of this repository that have been discarded due to their size being unacceptable. To help keep its repository size down and make it easier to tag releases of individual packages I have split this repository into a series of submodules one for each individual PKGBUILD. The packages are placed within git submodules within it.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • rpmbuild (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    Files for building RPM packages for Fedora and openSUSE.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • sabayon-tools (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My Portage overlay for Funtoo, Gentoo and Sabayon Linux, with ebuilds for programs not (or at least not at the time of me writing them) provided by the Portage Tree or official sabayon overlay. This overlay has an -old version too.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • void-packages (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My fork of the official Void packages repository; I used it for when

     Forked: Yes, from void-linux/void-packages.
    License: Not sure the name.
    README: Yes.

Packer

  • arch-builder (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    Packer template for building Arch Linux VMs.

     Forked: Yes, from elasticdog/packer-arch.
    License: ISC.
    README: Yes.
  • gentoo-packer (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    A repository of scripts for the setting up of a Gentoo VM. Originally designed to be used by Packer (by its original developer, Elasticdog), but if you try to use this fork of mine to build a Packer image odds are it will fail.

     Forked: Yes, from d11wtq/gentoo-packer.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.

Shell profiles

  • arch-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts for automating tasks I frequently perform on Arch Linux and other systems using the pacman package manager.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • centos-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts automatically loaded (as they are referenced in ~/.bashrc for both root and standard users) in Bash sessions that are designed to automate common system administration tasks under CentOS (and other systems using the yum package manager) like package management.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: No.
  • common-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts that automate tasks I frequently perform on a variety of different distributions.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • debian-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts automatically loaded on Bash startup that are designed to automate common tasks, especially package management, under Debian and its derivatives.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: No.
  • fedora-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts automatically loaded on Bash/Zsh startup that are designed to automate common command-line tasks on Fedora and other systems using the DNF package manager, including tasks related to package management.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • freebsd-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts automatically loaded on Zsh startup designed to automate common tasks on FreeBSD.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: No.
  • freebsd-zfs-manual-install Description:

    Scripts and instructions on how to install FreeBSD 11.2 on ZFS, alongside Arch Linux. While this is not a fork, half or so of the credit is owed to this post on the FreeBSD forums.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • funtoo-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts that are automatically loaded on startup, provided they are correctly installed on ones Funtoo machine, that automate some common tasks I perform on Funtoo, especially package management tasks.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • gentoo-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts that are automatically loaded on startup, provided they are correctly installed on ones Gentoo machine, that automate some common tasks I perform on Gentoo, especially package management tasks.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • Linux-scripts (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    (work in progress) Shell scripts designed to automate tasks on Linux systems, in general.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • mageia-scripts Description:

    Automatically-loaded from ~/.bashrc shell script functions for automating common tasks under Mageia.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: No.
  • netbsd-scripts Description:

    Automatically-loaded shell scripts for Bash and Zsh shells that helps with common tasks under NetBSD.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • openbsd-scripts Description:

    Automatically-loaded shell scripts for Bash and Zsh shells that helps with common tasks under OpenBSD.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • pclinuxos-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts that are automatically loaded on startup, provided they are correctly installed on ones PCLinuxOS machine, that automate some common tasks I perform on PCLinuxOS, especially package management tasks.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • pisi-scripts Description:

    Automatically-loaded shell-scripts for Bash and Zsh shells that help simplify common system management tasks on Pisi-based distros.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • sabayon-scripts Description:

    Automatically-loaded shell scripts (mostly containing variable definitions and functions) that can be used to automate some common tasks in Sabayon.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • slackware-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts that are automatically loaded on startup, provided they are correctly installed on ones Slackware machine, that automate some common tasks I perform on Slackware, especially package management tasks.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • void-scripts Description:

    Shell scripts that should be loaded on shell start up on Void Linux, in order to help automate tasks I frequently do.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.

Websites

  • fusion809.github.io Description:

    The main repository containing the contents of The Hornery. It is set up to use the Jekyll static site generator to convert its source documents into site content. Two other repositories (fusion809.github.io-{old,old2}) contain the old content of The Hornery. The reason why the old content is kept in these two separate repositories is because their overall size exceeded 90 MB and much of this size was due to the accidental committing of content not intended for The Hornery.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • hexo-site (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My attempt at creating a subdirectory of The Hornery with Hexo-generated content. It was meant to deploy at the /hexo subdirectory of The Hornery, but as you will see if you go there, it is not working as intended.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • hubpress.io (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    A subdirectory (/hubpress.io) of The Hornery (with no content so far) powered by the static site generator, HubPress.

     Forked: Yes, from HubPress/hubpress.io.
    License: MIT.
    README: Yes.
  • hugo-site (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My attempted at adding a /hugo-site subdirectory to The Hornery.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: Yes.
  • pelican-site (UNMAINTAINED) Description:

    My (so far failed) attempt at adding a /pelican subdirectory to The Hornery. See issue #1944 for details.

     Forked: No.
    License: GPLv3.
    README: No.

Where Brenton (fusion809) stores his thoughts, tutorials and news relating to technology.
